sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: Is It Too Late To Reassess Avino Silver & Gold Mines (TSX:ASM) After Its 5x Rally?
feed.summary: Avino Silver & Gold Mines (TSX:ASM) has experienced a significant rally, with its stock price increasing nearly 5x over the last year. Despite a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis suggesting the stock is 59.4% undervalued, its current P/E ratio of 51.75x is considerably higher than the industry average and Simply Wall St's Fair Ratio of 24.54x, indicating it might be overvalued by this metric. Investors are encouraged to use "Narratives" to form their own valuation based on realistic future expectations for revenue, earnings, and margins.

feed.title: Rogco LP Has $1.16 Million Stake in International Business Machines Corporation $IBM
feed.summary: Rogco LP significantly increased its stake in International Business Machines Corporation (IBM) by 2,730.3% in Q3, now holding 4,104 shares valued at $1.16 million. IBM recently surpassed quarterly earnings estimates with an EPS of $2.65 and revenue of $16.33 billion, demonstrating strong momentum in its AI and watsonx strategies. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for IBM, with an average target price of $305.29.

feed.title: Cintas Corporation (NASDAQ:CTAS) Announces $0.45 Quarterly Dividend
feed.summary: Cintas Corporation (NASDAQ:CTAS) has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.45 per share, representing an annualized dividend of $1.80 and a 0.9% yield. The company has a strong record of increasing its dividend for 42 consecutive years, with the payout covered by a 33.8% payout ratio. Cintas also reported slightly beating EPS estimates in the last quarter and authorized a $1.0 billion share buyback plan.

feed.title: VOC Energy Trust (NYSE:VOC) Plans $0.09 Quarterly Dividend
feed.summary: VOC Energy Trust (NYSE:VOC) declared a quarterly dividend of $0.09 per share, payable on February 13th to shareholders of record by January 30th. This dividend implies an annualized yield of 12.1%. Despite this, the company faces negative analyst sentiment, with a consensus "Sell" rating and a recent "sell" reaffirmation from Weiss Ratings.

feed.title: Wealth Enhancement Advisory Services LLC Has $45.81 Million Stock Holdings in S&P Global Inc. $SPGI
feed.summary: Wealth Enhancement Advisory Services LLC increased its stake in S&P Global Inc. (SPGI) by 4.9% during the third quarter, holding 95,184 shares valued at approximately $45.81 million. S&P Global exceeded Q3 earnings and revenue expectations, reported a raised quarterly dividend of $0.97, and maintains a consensus "Buy" rating from analysts with a target price of $615.64. The company's strong financial performance includes an 8.8% year-over-year revenue increase and a positive outlook for FY 2025 EPS.

feed.title: Analysts Offer Insights on Technology Companies: Salesforce (CRM), Dell Technologies (DELL) and Broadcom (AVGO)
feed.summary: Three analysts from Deutsche Bank and Evercore ISI have issued bullish ratings for Salesforce (CRM), Dell Technologies (DELL), and Broadcom (AVGO). Salesforce received a Buy rating with a $325.00 price target, Dell Technologies also got a Buy rating with a $180.00 price target, and Broadcom had its Buy rating reiterated with a $430.00 price target. The consensus among analysts suggests significant upside potential for all three technology stocks.

feed.title: RTX’s Collins Aerospace expands distribution network for C-130 parts
feed.summary: RTX's Collins Aerospace has expanded its C-130 parts distribution network through new three-year agreements with Integrated Procurement Technologies, S3 AeroDefense, and Derco. This move aims to enhance hardware and logistics support for C-130 Hercules wheels and brakes for international operators. The partnerships are expected to improve fleet readiness for the widely used military transport aircraft.

feed.title: Fiber/Small Cell Business Sale Sparks Confidence for Crown Castle (CCI)
feed.summary: Crown Castle Inc. (CCI) is gaining confidence from analysts following the sale of its fiber/small cell segment, allowing it to become a pure-play tower business. KeyBanc assigned an Overweight rating with a $120 price target, citing a 32% upside and contribution from a share buyback program. Wells Fargo maintained an Overweight rating despite a lowered price target due to potential proceeds from a lawsuit against DISH Wireless.

feed.title: KeyBanc Lowers Price Target for Crown Castle (CCI) to $115, Main
feed.summary: KeyBanc analyst Brandon Nispel has reaffirmed an Overweight rating for Crown Castle (CCI) but reduced the price target from $120 to $115. This adjustment follows similar price target reductions from other major firms like Goldman Sachs, UBS, and JP Morgan in January 2026. Crown Castle, a REIT, primarily operates wireless towers and is expected to divest its fiber business in 2026 to focus solely on towers.

feed.title: Bernstein reiterates Underperform rating on Fastenal stock amid onsite closures
feed.summary: Bernstein has reiterated an Underperform rating on Fastenal (NASDAQ:FAST) stock, setting a $38.00 price target despite the company's 11% sales growth in Q4 2025. Although Fastenal’s earnings per share met consensus, the industrial distributor missed gross margin and operating profit projections and closed 25% of its U.S. onsite locations in 2025, marking the first decline since 2014. The reiteration of the Underperform rating is supported by InvestingPro data showing Fastenal trading above its Fair Value and at a high P/E ratio relative to near-term earnings growth.

feed.title: PepsiCo, Inc. $PEP Shares Sold by Stock Yards Bank & Trust Co.
feed.summary: Stock Yards Bank & Trust Co. decreased its stake in PepsiCo, Inc. by 7.0% in the third quarter of 2025, selling 7,264 shares and ending with 97,210 shares valued at $13.65 million. Despite this sale, large institutions generally increased their holdings, with institutional ownership reaching 73.07%. Analysts are mixed on PEP, holding a consensus "Hold" rating and an average price target of $161.32.

feed.title: Barclays Adjusts Price Target on Public Service Enterprise Group to $81 From $87, Maintains Equalweight Rating
feed.summary: Barclays has lowered its price target for Public Service Enterprise Group (PEG) to $81 from $87, while maintaining an "Equalweight" rating on the stock. This adjustment reflects a moderated outlook for the utility company. The article also lists other recent analyst activities for Public Service Enterprise Group, showing a mix of upgrades, downgrades, and price target changes from various firms.

feed.title: Stock Yards Bank & Trust Co. Has $56.80 Million Stock Holdings in ASML Holding N.V. $ASML
feed.summary: Stock Yards Bank & Trust Co. increased its stake in ASML Holding N.V. by 3.4% in the third quarter, bringing its total holdings to 58,674 shares valued at $56.80 million, making ASML its 15th largest holding. Wall Street analysts have a "Moderate Buy" consensus rating for ASML with a target price of $1,392.75, driven by catalysts like TSMC's increased AI-focused capital expenditure. However, geopolitical risks and U.S.-China trade tensions present potential downside threats for the semiconductor company.

feed.title: Register Financial Advisors LLC Raises Stock Position in Beazer Homes USA, Inc. $BZH

feed.title: Arista Networks, Inc. $ANET Stake Increased by Stock Yards Bank & Trust Co.

This increase contributes to the 82.47% institutional ownership of the stock, while company insiders have been net sellers, disposing of over 160,000 shares worth approximately $20.49 million. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" rating for Arista Networks with a consensus target price of $164.44, following the company's recent beat on quarterly earnings estimates.

feed.title: American Electric Power Company, Inc. to Issue Quarterly Dividend of $0.95 (NASDAQ:AEP)
feed.summary: American Electric Power (NASDAQ:AEP) has announced a quarterly dividend of $0.95 per share, payable on March 10th to shareholders of record on February 10th. This translates to an annualized dividend of $3.80 and a yield of 3.2%. The company has a strong dividend history, having raised its payout for 15 consecutive years, with a payout ratio around 60.4% which is well-covered by expected earnings.

feed.title: Lam Research To Rally Around 17%? Here Are 10 Top Analyst Forecasts For Wednesday
feed.summary: This article compiles ten top analyst forecasts for Wednesday, highlighting price target changes and rating adjustments for various companies. Notably, Deutsche Bank increased Lam Research Corp's price target, suggesting a potential 17% rally. Other companies covered include Ardelyx Inc, Southern Copper Corp, Waste Management Inc, Carter's Inc, Netflix Inc, 3M Co, ServiceNow Inc, Westlake Corp, and Chipotle Mexican Grill Inc.

feed.title: Netflix Shares Fall After Earnings, Q1 Guidance Below Estimates
feed.summary: Netflix (NASDAQ: NFLX) shares dropped after the company released fourth-quarter financial results and first-quarter guidance that fell below analyst estimates. Despite beating Q4 EPS and revenue expectations, several firms lowered their price targets on the stock. Technical analysis indicates a challenging environment with the stock trading below key moving averages, though an oversold RSI suggests a potential rebound.

feed.title: Deutsche Bank Raises Price Target on KLA Corp. to $1,560 From $1,250, Keeps Hold Rating
feed.summary: Deutsche Bank has increased its price target for KLA Corp. (KLAC) to $1,560 from $1,250, while maintaining a Hold rating on the stock. This adjustment reflects a positive outlook for the company's valuation by the financial institution. The report was published on January 21, 2026, at 09:03 am EST.

feed.title: Venus Concept to exit NASDAQ and end SEC reporting obligations
feed.summary: Venus Concept Inc. announced its decision to delist from The Nasdaq Stock Market and deregister its common stock with the SEC. The company plans to file Form 25 with the SEC on or about January 29, 2026, and Form 15 shortly after, which will suspend its reporting obligations. This move aims to reduce costs and administrative burdens, with the company expecting to pay a one-time termination fee of $50,000 to NASDAQ.

feed.title: Hershey Debuts 'Happy Place' Olympic Push 01/21/2026
feed.summary: Hershey is launching its first Hershey's brand campaign since 2018, increasing its marketing budget by 20% to support "Hershey's. It's Your Happy Place." The campaign debuts ahead of the 2026 Winter Olympics and Paralympics, introducing five U.S. Olympians and Paralympians with a focus on happiness beyond medals. This initiative signals a broader shift in the company's brand storytelling, integrating paid, earned, shared, and owned channels, moving away from a primary focus on paid media.

feed.title: New RTX parts deals expand support to keep C-130 fleets mission-ready
feed.summary: Collins Aerospace, an RTX business, has signed three-year parts distribution agreements with Integrated Procurement Technologies, S3 AeroDefense, and Derco to enhance hardware and logistics support for C-130 Hercules wheels and brakes. These agreements aim to expand Collins' distribution network globally, ensuring improved fleet readiness for the C-130, an aircraft operated by over 70 countries. The DURACARB® brakes, produced in Troy, Ohio, offer longer life and reduced maintenance for the C-130 and other commercial and military aircraft.

feed.title: New double-stack rail link cuts Chicago–New England trips by up to 10 hours
feed.summary: Norfolk Southern has launched its "East Edge" double-stack intermodal corridor, connecting Chicago and New England, a $64 million investment aiming to reduce transit times by up to 10 hours. This new route enables fully double-stacked 9,000-foot trains, significantly increasing capacity and modernizing freight transport into New England. The project involved extensive infrastructure upgrades and is expected to boost intermodal growth and support the regional economy.

feed.title: What Makes American Homes 4 Rent (AMH) Attractive
feed.summary: American Homes 4 Rent (AMH) is considered an attractive real estate investment trust by hedge funds. While Keefe Bruyette upgraded its rating to Outperform with a $37 price target, BMO Capital downgraded AMH to Market Perform, also with a $37 price target, due to President Trump's proposal to ban institutional investment in single-family homes. American Homes 4 Rent operates and leases single-family rental homes and manages an online platform for tenants.

feed.title: Charles Schwab’s profit rises on higher interest income, trading revenues
feed.summary: Charles Schwab reported a rise in fourth-quarter profit, driven by increased interest income and strong trading revenues amid market volatility. The company's net revenue climbed 19% to US$6.34-billion, slightly below analyst estimates, while net income reached US$2.46-billion. Schwab also saw record core net new assets for the quarter, bringing its total asset gathering for the year 2025 to over half a trillion U.S. dollars.

feed.title: American Homes 4 Rent's (AMH) Market Outperform Rating Reiterated at Citizens Jmp
feed.summary: Citizens Jmp has reiterated a "Market Outperform" rating for American Homes 4 Rent (AMH) with a $41.00 price target, suggesting a 29% upside. While analysts are mixed, the company recently surpassed quarterly earnings estimates and increased its FY2025 guidance. Insider transactions show directors acquiring shares, indicating confidence in the real estate investment trust.

feed.title: Abbott Laboratories (ABT) Q4 Earnings Report Preview: What To Look For
feed.summary: Abbott Laboratories (ABT) is set to announce its Q4 earnings, with analysts expecting a 7.6% year-on-year revenue growth to $11.8 billion and adjusted earnings of $1.49 per share. The company met revenue expectations last quarter, and analysts have reconfirmed their estimates. Despite positive sentiment in the healthcare equipment segment, ABT stock is down 2.7% over the last month, heading into earnings with an average analyst price target of $144.75 against a current share price of $121.14.

feed.title: Prologis shares up after Q4 beat on strong warehouse leasing By Investing.com
feed.summary: Prologis Inc (NYSE:PLD) reported better-than-expected fourth-quarter profits and revenue, driven by robust warehouse leasing activity. The company signed a record 228 million square feet of leases in 2025, positioning it for strong earnings growth in 2026, and also expanded power capacity for data center demand. Prologis provided optimistic guidance for 2026 net earnings and core FFO.

feed.title: This Microcap Company Announced Plans To Delist Just Days After The Stock Surged 450% — What Happened?
feed.summary: Venus Concept Inc. (VERO) stock crashed over 50% after the company announced plans to voluntarily delist from Nasdaq and deregister with the SEC. This decision, made after Madryn Asset Management acquired a 91% stake, prioritizes reducing compliance costs over the benefits of a public listing. The shares had surged 450% just days before the delisting announcement.

feed.title: Nvidia, Broadcom, Micron among JPMorgan's favorite chip stocks going into earnings (NVDA:NASDAQ)
feed.summary: J.P. Morgan has named Nvidia, Broadcom, and Micron as its top semiconductor stock picks ahead of the coming earnings season. The investment bank anticipates that companies will report strong results for Q4 2025 and provide optimistic guidance. J.P. Morgan also foresees significant growth in the AI accelerator market and a general industry revenue increase of over 15% for the year, driven by market recovery and lean inventories.

feed.title: BNP Paribas Exane Downgrades Dollar Tree to Underperform From Neutral, Adjusts Price Target to $87 From $118
feed.summary: BNP Paribas Exane has downgraded Dollar Tree (DLTR) from "Neutral" to "Underperform" and significantly reduced its price target from $118 to $87. This comes amidst other recent analyst adjustments for Dollar Tree, with some maintaining buy ratings while others have also lowered their outlooks. Dollar Tree, a leading American discount retailer, operates a large network of stores across the US and Canada.

feed.title: Netflix Earnings Were a Flop. Why the Warner Bros. Bidding War Is Spooking Wall Street.
feed.summary: Netflix's fourth-quarter earnings report failed to impress investors, as weak margin guidance led to a decline in share prices. The article suggests that investor concerns might also be linked to the ongoing bidding war for Warner Bros. and its potential implications for the streaming industry.

feed.title: Ulta Beauty price target raised to $750 from $675 at Oppenheimer
feed.summary: Oppenheimer has increased its price target for Ulta Beauty (ULTA) to $750 from $675, while maintaining an Outperform rating. This adjustment reflects a recent re-rating in discretionary consumer stocks and increased confidence in Ulta's new product pipeline for FY26, including the forthcoming Rare Beauty launch. The firm also highlighted other drivers for top-line growth, such as merchandising and digital initiatives, and expressed strong confidence in CEO Kecia Steelman's leadership.

feed.title: Fortinet price target lowered to $88 from $95 at Truist
feed.summary: Truist has lowered its price target for Fortinet (FTNT) to $88 from $95, while maintaining a Buy rating on the shares. This adjustment comes as part of a broader research note previewing the fourth quarter for cybersecurity companies. The firm anticipates strong Q4 reports and a conservative guidance approach, noting that market pressure has shifted toward AI hardware despite continued momentum in Security & AI initiatives.

feed.title: Rakuten Investment Management Inc. Invests $42.32 Million in KKR & Co. Inc. $KKR
